title: 1990 Players Championship
text:
The 1990 Players Championship was a <a href="golf">golf</a> tournament in <a href="Florida">Florida</a> on the <a href="PGA%20Tour">PGA Tour</a>, held at <a href="TPC%20Sawgrass">TPC Sawgrass</a> in <a href="Ponte%20Vedra%20Beach%2C%20Florida">Ponte Vedra Beach</a>, southeast of <a href="Jacksonville%2C%20Florida">Jacksonville</a>. It was the seventeenth <a href="The%20Players%20Championship">Players Championship</a>. 
<a href="Jodie%20Mudd">Jodie Mudd</a> won the title at 278 (−10), one stroke ahead of runner-up <a href="Mark%20Calcavecchia">Mark Calcavecchia</a>.
Defending champion <a href="Tom%20Kite">Tom Kite</a> finished seven strokes back, in a tie for fifth place.
Venue.
This was the ninth Players Championship held at the TPC at Sawgrass Stadium Course. The Stadium Course was lengthened this year to , an increase of .

Round summaries.
First round.
"Thursday, March 15, 1990"
Second round.
"Friday, March 16, 1990"
Third round.
"Saturday, March 17, 1990"<br>
"Sunday, March 18, 1990"
Due to weather delays, Mudd completed the last fourteen holes of his third round on Sunday morning. 
Final round.
"Sunday, March 18, 1990"
